title: Besime Konca
text:
Besime Konca (born 1970, Maras) is a <a href="Kurds">Kurdish</a> politician of the <a href="Peoples%27%20Democratic%20Party%20%28Turkey%29">Peoples' Democratic Party</a>. 
She was detained from 1993 to 2004 for political activities and again from 2009 to 2014 within the KCK main case. At the general elections of <a href="November%202015%20Turkish%20general%20election">1 November 2015</a> she got elected as an MP for Siirt. 
She got arrested on 13 December 2016 and was released on probation on 3 May 2017.
Konca was sent to prison on 29 May 2017 again and got released on 28 July 2017. In July 2017 a court in <a href="Gaziantep">Gaziantep</a> confirmed another sentence of two and a half years against Konca for being a member of an armed organization and spreading propaganda for a terror organization. Following, she was relieved of her rights and duties as an MP. After the renewed sentence she left <a href="Turkey">Turkey</a> and went to live in exile to Europe. The State Prosecutor at the <a href="Court%20of%20Cassation%20%28Turkey%29">Court of Cassation</a> in Turkey <a href="Bekir%20%C5%9Eahin">Bekir Şahin</a> filed a lawsuit before the <a href="Constitutional%20Court%20of%20Turkey">Constitutional Court</a> on the 17 March 2021, demanding for Konca and 686 other HDP politicians a five-year ban to engage in politics.
